bib.title: Testing Zipf’s meaning-frequency law with wordnets as sense inventories
bib.author: Bond, Francis and Janz, Arkadiusz and Maziarz, Marek and Rudnicka, Ewa
bib.abstract: According to George K. Zipf, more frequent words have more senses. We have tested this law using corpora and wordnets of English, Spanish, Portuguese, French, Polish, Japanese, Indonesian and Chinese. We have proved that the law works pretty well for all of these languages if we take-as Zipf did-mean values of meaning count and averaged ranks. On the other hand, the law disastrously fails in predicting the number of senses for a single lemma. We have also provided the evidence that slope coefficients of Zipfian log-log linear
bib.booktitle: Proceedings of the 10th Global Wordnet Conference
